channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Trump cancels meeting with top Democrats as threat of government shutdown looms
item.description: President Trump canceled a meeting to discuss government funding with top Democrats in Congress, leaving no clear path to avoiding a government shutdown next week.

item.title: Democratic strategist on how Democrats should approach shutdown negotiations
item.description: As a government shutdown looms, how should Democrats approach negotiations with Republican leaders? NPR speaks with Democratic strategist Maria Cardona.

item.title: President Trump to meet with Brazil's president after months of tension
item.description: Despite months of tension, President Trump says he'll meet with Brazil's president next week, claiming they had "excellent chemistry" during a brief exchange at the U.N. General Assembly.

item.title: NPR's middle school champion: A moving podcast about Japanese incarceration
item.description: For the first time, NPR's Student Podcast Challenge has a returning champion: a California fifth grader who explored a dark chapter in U.S. history during World War II.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump cancels government funding meeting with top Democrats, Trump -- in a reversal -- declares Ukraine "can win back all territory lost to Russia," Jimmy Kimmel returns to late night.

item.title: UAE diplomatic advisor talks about the country's role in Middle East conflicts
item.description: NPR speaks with Anwar Gargash, diplomatic advisor to the president of the United Arab Emirates, about the country's role in the conflicts in the Middle East and Sudan.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel returns to late night after nearly week-long suspension
item.description: In an emotional monologue Tuesday night, Jimmy Kimmel said it was never his "intention to make light of the murder of a young man." The host also issued a warning about threats to free speech.

item.title: Democrat wins congressional seat in Arizona, narrowing GOP's slim House majority
item.description: In a special election, voters in southern Arizona have chosen to send Democrat Adelita Grijalva to Congress, narrowing the GOP's slim majority in the House.

item.title: Kamala Harris backs Zohran Mamdani as top Democrats keep their distance
item.description: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani got a major endorsement this week from former Vice President Kamala Harris. But many Democratic leaders remain distant, fueling growing tension.

item.title: Trump, in major reversal, suggests Ukraine can win back territory held by Russia
item.description: On the U.N. General Assembly's opening day, President Trump declared Ukraine "can win back all territory lost to Russia," marking a sharp reversal from earlier statements he's made about the war.
